title: How has technology made the world worse? - Quora

response.answer_text: Technology is not ruining our world, we are. There is no point in blaming the tool; if there is blame, it is attached to the user. In fact, we could not live without technology, given our enormous and ever expanding population as well as the fact that so many of us live in huge cities. One may think of technology as the TV, the laptop and the cell phone, but it is also and especially the truck that brings our food and other supplies to the city and the store where we buy such. It is the plane that brings professionals to share information and the trade negotiators to arrange the wherewithals of supply. It is the electric cables and the sewers, without which we would live short and nasty lives. It is the vaccines and medications that enable us to prevent or treat illness. Tech is essential to our continued survival; if the tech lapsed, most of us would be dead. So what is ruining the world? it is what we do with some of the tech, perhaps with all of the tech. We adapt the tech to weaponry and destruction. We misuse it by creating complex, badly engineered, lacking quality control products because failure means repair or replacement, and repair or replacement mean greater profit. It also means increased requirement for and usage of irreplaceable resources, greater wastage, more energy converted into heat, and therefore ruin for the earth and extinction for us. But please, do not be misled. No nuclear bomb cried for its production. No balky fridge or washing machine asked to be made badly. No auto wanted to be fitted with an unreliable transmission, air bag or inefficient engine. No computer wept for a bloated, fractious system replete with bugs exploitable by hackers that is updated mostly for the benefit of advertisers but does little for ordinary users who hate the ever changing configurations. The tech has nothing to say; we do all the talking, do all the doings, make all the mistakes, and bring closer to ourselves the inevitability of ruin. Tech is not our enemy, it is our benefactor and life saver. As Pogo once said, “I have seen the enemy, and he is us”.
